title: Belief Systems Project
descriptions:
Title: Belief Systems Project

This grant proposal seeks funding for the Belief Systems Project, an innovative research endeavor aimed at understanding the basic structure of belief systems and their role in shaping democratic politics, extremism, and political decision-making. Current research is hindered by flawed conceptualization and a lack of consideration for interrelationships between beliefs. Our project addresses these limitations by conceptualizing belief systems as complex networks of interconnecting attitudes and values, which will be analyzed using network analyses.

The proposed study will utilize a multi-method approach, incorporating survey data, longitudinal panel studies, intensive longitudinal designs, experiments, and text analyses. The project's objectives include mapping the structure of systems of attitudes and values, identifying central concepts and clustering patterns, modeling within-person belief systems and variations, and testing changes in belief systems due to external and internal pressures. The study will examine the structure of political belief systems over time, between countries, and within individuals, providing a comprehensive understanding of this critical aspect of political behavior. By advancing our knowledge of belief systems, this project will contribute to a deeper understanding of democratic politics and extremism.
